intro: Stephanophysum asperulum, commonly known as the rough-stephanophysum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape and have a rough, textured surface, giving the plant its common name. Native to regions of southern Africa, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
